channel.title: Configuring default umask?
channel.description:
Hi all, I realize changing the default `umask` only has limited benefit, but nonetheless I would like to set it to `077`.
I've tried everything I can think of - all the profile config files in my home directory, the login defaults configuration file, etc, yet nothing seems to work.
What am I missing? TIA

item.title: Configuring default umask?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I haven’t found any single place to change the default umask for everything. Maybe the post promising place would be PAM. But I haven’t found a way to implement it without breaking too many things.

References:

  • change default umask - Development - Whonix Forum
  • Restrict umask to 027 except for sudo/root broken · Issue #185 · Kicksecure/security-misc · GitHub
  • Debian feature request:
    change Debian’s default umask to a more secure value such as umask 0077

Read full topic
